class_notes:
This course will be taught online. It meets for one synchronous 75-minute session per week on Monday. The rest of the material will be delivered asynchronously.
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Theme.
As an introduction to the academic study of religion -- including how to define the very term religion -- this course will investigate the role of religion in this age of global pandemic. With a focus on several religious traditions around the world, we will examine the diverse ways global pandemic impacts religion and, in turn, how religious leaders and believers have responded to the pandemic through the re-interpretation of sacred texts, the re-calibration of religious ritual, and the relationship between religion and science.
course_description: An exploration of diverse ways of being religious (for example, in thought, action, community, and experience) as they are displayed in several traditions and cultures.
